nodes.text: Tantajoc V was a jungle-covered planet in the Tantajo system of the Mid Rim Halori sector. Tantajoc V orbited a binary star and was completely uninhabited by sentients as of 3 ABY, although its harsh and humid forests teemed with dangerous predators. After fleeing a coup on nearby Velmor in 17 BBY, Velmorian crown prince Denid and his retainer Jedidiah crash-landed on Tantajoc V, where they survived for the next 20 years in a hostile environment. Rebel leaders Leia Organa and Luke Skywalker tracked Denid's distress signal to Tantajoc V in 3 ABY, finally rescuing him from his exile and returning him to Velmor to assume his throne.

Tantajoc V first appeared in Star Wars 49, written by Mike W. Barr, illustrated by Walter Simonson and released in 1981. Although the world went unnamed in its original comic appearance, its name was given in 2003, as part of the Wizards of the Coast article Velmor: Royalty and Rebellion.
